column4: Hey everybody.  What is a good C IDE for gutsy?  I was toying with a kdevelop on a virtual KDE (slackware) and it looked GOOD.  I just want to know what's a good one for ubuntu?
Anjuta is the rough equivalent
in a linux livecd. use loop to mount the image file
mount -t auto -o loop /path/to/root.img /mnt/
check in its homepage
no problem
at <enter> writte your command even various lines <crtl + d>
at sometime_in_the_future <enter> writte your command even various lines <crtl + d>
i can not think on a situation where you want to run an editor somewhere in the future...
but yes i spect gui programs to fail in at
any suggestion of something I could run with  at  to test to see if it'll work?  I can't think of anything that doesn't have a gui
aplay /usr/share/sounds/question.wav
make sure you have the speakers on ;)
got it thanks :O)
HEY it worked thank you :OD
no problem
postscript
man vmstat --> wa: Time spent waiting for IO. Prior to Linux 2.5.41, included in idle.
next time *you* read the man page ;)
any way to open a commands man page in gedit?
no; you can use yelp (system>help and support) to view man pages
yelp man:vmstat
haha NICE thank you
